alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:43PM MDT until May 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT FOR WESTERN KIMBALL AND SOUTHEASTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 543 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Gun Barrel to near Pine Bluffs to near Panorama Point, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Pine Bluffs, Burns, Oliver Campground, Panorama Point, Oliver Reservoir and Bushnell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 386 and 402. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 1 and 15. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
